Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Shut up!     Leave now.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You were awesome.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Really? Be honest. I'd rather you tell me I sucked then lie.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You were great.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Excuse me for a second.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Ow, ow, ow alright.    I'm going.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: So you really enjoyed it?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Yeah. Good song.      What made you pick it?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Oh, uh... my mother was humming it all last week. Big Doors fan.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Really?   Is she here?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: She missed out.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: You're so sweet.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Yeah well, I have to go, but thanks again. I had a great time.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That boy is going to bring the entire house down.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Let him be. He's looking good. I'm proud of him.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Girls, have you decided what you're going to go as for Halloween?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Either a witch or a princess.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That's nice. Haley?

Speaker: haley
Dialogue: I'm going to go as a marble.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: What do you mean, a marble?

Speaker: haley
Dialogue: You know, like a bag of marbles, but just one marble.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: I'm really sorry, man.   I...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You just think about what I said. Get out of my sight. And send Kenny in on your way out.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: What did you say to him?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I thought you'd both like to know that Halloween was Rudy's favorite holiday.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Stop it.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: After we'd go trick or treating, we'd sit in our room and swap the candy we hated. Rudy loved Snickers, I Almond Joys.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Almond Joy sucks.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What sucks is that I'll never get to sit in my room and swap candy with my brother ever again. Thanks to you.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Why are you doing this?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: To remind you.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: How could we forget? You been coming here for months to "remind us".

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No one is forcing you to talk to me.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Anything to get out of my cell.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Is your cell small?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: So is a coffin.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You're not the only one who wishes he was still alive. I'd do anything to bring him back, but I can't. It's not easy being in here. Hell, you saw Jeff.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What happened to him?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: He pissed off the wrong guy off. Jeff is totally fucked right now.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Don't come back here ever again.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Free country. I'll come if I want.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Don't expect me to show up.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Be careful now.   Have a good night.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Kids keep coming later every year.

Speaker: haley
Dialogue: I hate him! I hate him!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Who?    What happened?

Speaker: haley
Dialogue: Leonard! He threw away all our Halloween candy.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: He grabbed our bags and just threw them down a gutter.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What the hell is going on? Why did you throw away their candy?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Because their sugar intake is completely unhealthy. Besides, Halloween is supposed to be a celebration of evil. How did candy get wrapped into it?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I am going to ask you this once, and I want a straight answer. Are you in a cult?

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Grace!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: This is what happens when kids join cults. The first thing they change is their diets.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I'm not in a cult. This is all information you can find in books.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: The issue here is that you have stolen one of the most exciting nights of the year from your sisters.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: If anybody had done this to you when you were a child, we never would have heard the end of it.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I wish somebody had done it to me. I wish either one of you had given a shit about my weight.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I do not care for your language.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I'm only trying to help you guys.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What's your point?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Dad, you and mom are going to die young if you keep eating as poorly as you do.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What is this obsession you have with weight?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: The coach for Jefferson High is also my gym teacher. He told me that if I got into shape, I could start as center for the Freshman team when I get to high school.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Center is a great position. Toughest guy on the field. A good center can make or break a team.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I know.   That's why I'm trying so hard to get into shape. You guys should to. At the rate you're going, you won't make it to your 60's.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Look, Leonard. Your mom, to her, a tasty meal is just a way of showing she cares.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: She doesn't! Tonight she served spaghetti and meatballs from a can. The amount of sodium alone can wreck havoc on a person's blood pressure. Not to mention...

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Leonard, people just don't drop dead from eating meatballs.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I can't take your Halloween candy.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: You'll be doing me a favor. Chocolate gives you zits. Besides, if I want to keep this firm ass as an adult, I gotta develop good eating habits now.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Maybe just a snickers.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: So work is good?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: To be honest, I can't wait till this job is finished. This place is creepy. You know, a boy died here like right before we started working.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Rudy.   His name was Rudy.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You knew him?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: He was one of my best friends. Remember that funeral I went to?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: That was him?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I thought you knew. Two boys threw a flaming cocktail at him. Can you imagine killing someone like that? How evil can you get?

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: Jeff Laskey is dead.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: He committed suicide in his jail cell last night. Sally Yngve called just now to tell me.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Why are you smiling?    A boy died.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: No, a monster that murdered my son died. Justice is served; end of story.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: He used his bed sheet, waited until lights out and then jumped.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That's terrible.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: His cell mate let him hang there the entire night.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Kenny.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Like you even give a shit. I bet when you heard, you started dancing.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I knew he wouldn't make it. It's my fault too. Jeff wasn't a saint when I met him, but he sure as hell wasn't headed here.  That fucking asshole!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: An IPOD!   Sweet!

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: You like it?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I love it.     You guys went crazy this year.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I'm going to shower.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: Jim, Jacob still has one more present.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I thought we were going to wait.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No, do it now! Now!

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: After serious debate, your father and I have decided... to adopt A BABY!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: We're gonna adopt a baby. Hopefully a boy.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: May I be excused?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Why do I have to do this? It's Christmas break.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: You'll be one step ahead in January.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Just because you're an atheist, I don't get to celebrate the holidays.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Malee.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I'm going for a bike ride.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: There's a foot of snow outside.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: The streets are ploughed. Besides, I like looking at all the lights.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Be home in an hour. Be careful.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Freeze!   That's right.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Don't worry, white male infants are the hardest to come by. 60 minutes did a whole story on it.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Since when do you watch 60 minutes?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Since I was in the hospital. They said, any adoption agency worth its salt has at least a three year waiting list. By the time your parents get a kid, you'll be in college. You think they'll want to start over again with that baby shit?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No, but it's like they're trying to replace Rudy.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: It doesn't matter cause it's not gonna happen.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I'm thirsty.  Can you get us some drinks?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Why me?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Because it's the gentlemanly thing to do.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'll get the drinks.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I'll go with you.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Why are you all of a sudden going to get the drinks?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Because you've upset me, and I don't want to see you right now.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Fine, I'll get the drinks.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I need a favor. It's big. I need you to hide something for me.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Hide what?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Promise, you won't freak.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I won't.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: You said, you wouldn't freak!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That's a gun.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Where'd you get it?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I can't tell you. I just need you to hide it for a while. When all is cool, I'll come for it.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Why can't you keep it?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: My mother is a total snoop. She goes through my stuff like all the time.  Please, Jacob. Somebody's life might depend on it.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Is it loaded?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: No, but I do have some bullets.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Nobody has the combination, but me. Besides, I could be building a bomb in here, and they wouldn't even know.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I sent in some comics for ya.   The X-men one is pretty sweet.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: That last batch was awesome.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I better get going, I don't want to miss my bus.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Before you go, I got some news. Apparently, the parole board feels I've been a model prisoner, so they're giving me early release.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What?   How can they do that?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I don't know. They just did. You're pissed, aren't you? I knew you would be.  It was an accident, Jacob.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: So you're getting out.   Gonna head back to school, or...

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Fuck school. I'm going to live with my Dad in New Mexico. He's working on a ranch out there.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You can't leave the state. That violates your probation. You'll have to...

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: My dad won't tell anyone. No one will even care I'm out there.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Your mom will.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Jacob, in the entire time I've been locked up, you were the only one who came to see me. Trust me, she won't care.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: 200 dollars! Dad sent me 200 dollars!

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: No!  Your father... went out.     He's not home right now.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: You're acting weird.     What's going on?

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Well, do you want to come with me to the mall and spend it?

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: I'd prefer it if you'd put that money in the bank.  Fine, spend it. You'll have to do it alone though. I have a patient this afternoon. Have a good day.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Here's the deal. You know how my company flies me to Florida every April?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You and I have been going since I was eight. It's the guy's week off.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: This year, I'm taking the girls. Just the girls. You're staying home.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Why can't we all go?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I'm not staying here all alone. Besides, you said it yourself, you've been going for years. Give your sisters a chance.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Whatever.  I need money.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Clothes.    Nothing I have fits anymore.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Your father and I aren't rich. You can't get a new wardrobe anytime you want.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do, go to school naked?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Wear a belt.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: I'll give him some cash, he can get some clothes.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: No. He's gonna gain all his weight back in a few months.

Speaker: patrick
Dialogue: Grace.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: What?    It's true.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: When I was fat. Now I don't have to wear a T-shirt when I go swimming. Who knows, maybe I could even get lucky.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You're still ugly, though.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I don't understand what my mother's problem is. It's like the thinner I get, the more she hates me.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: She's probably jealous. Maybe you should put her on that diet.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Anytime I mention it, my mother goes crazy.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: If you really want her to drop a few tons, put her in jail. Kenny's lost about 30 pounds since he's been incarcerated, and he was already thin.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Yeah. Jail is the perfect weight loss program. You take a fat tub, throw them in a room and force them to eat right and exercise. Don't let them out till they do.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Malee, dinner!

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I got a new look. You know, for Spring. What do you think?

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: You look...

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Beautiful?

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Different. What happened to your glasses?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Contacts. It took me like forty five minutes to get them in, but beauty is pain.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Honey, in the future, I'd like to know if you're going to radically change your appearance. Clean your stuff up and come down for dinner.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Malee?   My God, you look...

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Different?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Beautiful.     You look beautiful.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I felt like I needed a change, you know?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I bet you're driving the boys at school wild.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Boys my age are so immature. I'm more attracted to older gentlemen.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You don't want somebody that much older than you. An age difference can cause problems.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: What kind of problems?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: A lot of times when a couple has an age difference, they wind up splitting up because they want different things.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: You mean sex.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Are you impatient?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: No, but when I was a kid.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Why don't you have a girlfriend?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I did, but it didn't work out.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: How old was she?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: About my age.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: See that, age wasn't an issue, yet you still wanted different things. I don't think it's about age.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Have a good flight!

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: We're home.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: Could you come downstairs for a minute. We have a surprise for you.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: This is Keith Gardner. You're new brother. Keith our son, Jacob.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: It's nice to meet you.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You get top bunk.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: I'm kind of afraid of heights.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Sucks to be you.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: I never thought my future brother would have a KOOL AID stain, smeared across his face.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Fuck you, it's a birthmark!

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: We're getting off on the wrong foot.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: When my parents said they were taking in an orphan, I pictured a baby. So what happened, your parents die or something?

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: I was given up at birth.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You gonna try and find your mother when you're 18?

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: As far as I'm concerned, the fact she had me was enough. I don't need to show up one day and disrupt her life.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Oh, but it's okay to just show up one day and disrupt mine?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You're blaming me for this?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No.   But can you believe it?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Maybe this is the only way they can get over Rudy's death.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: He's a person not a fucking vase.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I gotta get out of there. I can't live in that house for one more day. I want to go with you to New Mexico.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: No way. You've never even   been out on the road.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: So.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: It's not easy. After first night falls, you'll be pissing yourself.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No, I won't.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You don't need me to run away from home.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That's not what this is about.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Yes, it is.  And you want to come with ME of all people. Are you forgetting, I was the one who killed Rudy!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: That was an accident.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: If this is what you want.   Alright.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Is that Dad? Can I talk to him?

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Take some responsibility for yourself and grow... Hello?...

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Well, what do you expect?   All you ever do is yell at him.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Malee, you don't understand.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: He's my Dad! I'm sorry if it bothers you, but I love him. You keep this up then one day, when I'm old enough, I'll leave here and go and stay with him.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Leonard?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Leonard, what's wrong?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I'm calling 9-1-1!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: If I go downstairs, I won't be able to make it back up. Let me call 9-1-1 first, okay?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I hope someone is hungry.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Get me out of here now!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: No joke, Ma. For the next two weeks while Dad and the girls are away, you will be kept down here. I'll provide you with nutritious meals and plenty of water. You, mother, will learn what it means to be healthy.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That's what this is about, food?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: I'm trying to save your life, mom. Trying to give you a life. Cause I love you.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: My life is fine.   I don't need you to "save me".

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You don't even realize how sick you are. It's a problem when an otherwise healthy woman can't drag her ass up a flight of stairs because she's so obese. You're staying down here.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: I made dinner, my love.   And I have a surprise.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You've been in my apartment before, haven't you?

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Don't you like my body?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Malee, stop.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: It's okay because I love you.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: To go call your mother.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: But we're soulmates.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: I don't know what to say to you.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Wanna play some catch?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Where the hell did you get this?

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: The closet. Ow, what's wrong?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Did I say you could play with the glove? Did I?

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: No, I just...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Everything, and I mean, EVERYTHING in this room is mine. You are not allowed to touch a thing, especially the glove.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Okay, okay.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: If you tell my parents what I said, I'll kill you. I'll shoot you in the fucking face, I swear it!

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: What's wrong now?

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: I was looking at a picture of you and Rudy when you were born. God, I miss him.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: But you have Keith now

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: What the hell does that mean?

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You have Keith. Two boys again. Everything is fine.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: We didn't adopt Keith to replace Rudy.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Didn't you?

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: For your information, your father and I discussed adopting for years.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Right. Maybe if it was me who died, you wouldn't need another kid to get over it.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: How can you say that? I never wanted either of my children to die.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: But one of us did. If you had to choose which one, I bet you wish it was me.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: I know you think we favored Rudy...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: You did!    Admit it.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: I admit he was easier to raise, but we didn't love him more. Jacob, listen to me. You came with a different set of challenges.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: My birthmark.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: It's not easy being different...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: I'm not different!! You always made me feel like something was wrong. There's nothing wrong with me.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: I know...

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: No, you don't! It's like you don't know how to deal with me. You never did.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: I'm sorry if that is how you feel. You do the best you can as a parent. You don't always know what's right. But you're my son. I'd do anything for you. I'd fight for you, I'd kill for you, I'd die for you.

Speaker: jacob
Dialogue: Rudy used to say that exact same thing.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: It's true. And as unchristian as it sounds, I still want the boy that killed Rudy dead. Someday, when you grow up, you'll understand what I mean. Someday.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: When Pat calls, and I don't answer, he'll know something is wrong. He'll know. I'll be fine.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Open this door now! Let me out, God damn it! Leonard!

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Before we begin, I want to apologize. I should have known what was going on with Malee.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: It's my fault. I knew she had a crush on me. I guess, I felt bad for her. She's a very unhappy girl.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: This is your therapy. Not mine. Why was it therapeutic?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I slept last night. I can't remember the last time I slept so deep or so sound. I don't remember dreaming or anything.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Why do you think that is?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: One of the last fires I ever fought was a brownstone, beautiful. The place was burned from roof to basement. Whole family was wiped out. When I was upstairs, inspecting, I found a girl. She couldn't have been more than 12.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: What did you do?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Exactly what she wanted. I placed my hand over her mouth and what was left of her nose, and I... I killed her. I told myself it was the right thing to do, but I've never been sure.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: What does this have to do with Malee?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: When I saw her last night, she had the same look on her face as that girl. She just wanted me to take away her pain.

Speaker: yacco
Dialogue: Would you mind if we... cut out early today? No charge.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: malee
Dialogue: Why does he hate me?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Leonard!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Leonard, don't you smell that...?  Oh God, he can't. Leonard! Leonard, the gas is on!

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: It's alive!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Gas leak.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: My mom, she's...

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: She's fine. They've taken her into surgery. She blew out her knees somehow. We're trying to get your father on the phone right now.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Shh. You need your rest. Everything is fine now.

Speaker: kenny
